abstract: On Oct. 14, 1964, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was named the winner of the Nobel Peace Prize.
snippet: On Oct. 14, 1964, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was named the winner of the Nobel Peace Prize.
lead_paragraph: On Oct. 14, 1964, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was named the winner of the Nobel Peace Prize. The Oct. 15 New York Times quoted the civil rights leader: "I do not consider this merely an honor to me personally, but a tribute to the disciplined, wise restraint and majestic courage of gallant Negro and white persons of goodwill who have followed a nonviolent course in seeking to establish a reign of justice and a rule of love across this nation of ours."

headline.main: Oct. 14, 1964 | Martin Luther King Awarded Nobel Peace Prize
